channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

  • City: SYLMAR

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO A LEAKER FOR BULK BELT, UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER NOTICED A CLASS 8 CORROSIVE DIAMOND LABEL, RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE TO CLEAN UP SPILLAGE. THEN RESPONDER TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AND FOLLOWED THE RESPONSE SHEET FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024030606
item.description:
Report X-2024030606

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: SAN JOSE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 3/12/2024 at approximately 1200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5805558 at the station location in San Jose, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of 4 fiberboard boxes, each containing 10 metal cans. One of the cans in one of the packages appeared to accidentally discharged, resulting in spillage. The unharried packages have been delivered and the affected package is being held for an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report E-2024030301
item.description:
Report E-2024030301

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: KETTLEMAN CITY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UKC experienced a UN1814 Potassium Hydroxide 45% release from (4) 55-gallon poly drums. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to 6’ x 6’ area of the top of each poly drum. All four drums in shipment were found to have faulty bung caps, causing them to release. Each drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack after being wiped down. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024030474
item.description:
Report X-2024030474

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-19T15:11:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM THE OVERHEAD SORTER OPEN WITH GOODS MISSING. LIMITED QUANTITY LABEL OBSCURED BY PACKING SLIP COVERING IT UP. TOO MUCH RECIRCULATION THROUGH THE OVERHEAD SORTER. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM DENTED BODY, TWO OTHERS MISSING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED WITH ABSORBENT MATERIALS. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2024030416
item.description:
Report X-2024030416

  • State: CA

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED AT THE PD6 IRREG DOCK AND WAS SHOWN THAT THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING FROM THE BOTTOM. RESPONDER GRABBED GREEN BAG TOTE SCOOPED UP THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND CLEANED UP ANY SPILL THAT IT LEFT. TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024030457
item.description:
Report X-2024030457

  • City: SACRAMENTO

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET, TORN AND LEAKING. DAMAGED DURING SORTATION, CRUSHED AT PINCHPOINT. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE OF DETERGENT WITH 3 INCH CRACK BEHIND THE HANDLE WITH 2 TENTHS OF A GALLON LOSS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED AND NEUTRALIZED WITH PH9 AND DUSTPAN. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2024030218
item.description:
Report X-2024030218

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Exterior packaging in a box that is wrapped around with a black plastic bag when a leak was noticed while unloading. DescribePack: 4 qty of 1 gallon container of Algae X are the inner containers. 2 of which shows signs of being crushed from the body being dented and leakage from the cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package immediately placed inside a plastic lined container and wiped off any leaks.

item.title: Report X-2024030217
item.description:
Report X-2024030217

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-19T15:11:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Exterior packaging was dyed black on one corner. Inside were 10 qty of 1-liter inks in a plastic container. DescribePack: 3 bottles showed sign of leakage with the end of each cap still wet with the ink. Though only a few ounces spilled, the box quickly turned black. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately placed inside a plastic lined container and wiped off any spill.

IT WAS DISCOVERD TWO JUGS HAD LOOSE CAPS CAUSING LEAKAGE AND SOILED THE OHER TWO JUGS DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. 2. It was discovered two jugs had loose caps causing leakage and soiled the other jugs DescribePack: loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in a lined tote

item.title: Report E-2024030261
item.description:
Report E-2024030261

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UAD experienced a UN1823 Caustic Soda Micropearls release from (2) 50-pound paper bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8-ounces of material released to a 7’ x 6’ area of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged bags were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The recovered product, impacted shrink wrap, cardboard, and PPE were collected and containerized into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024030586
item.description:
Report X-2024030586

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: SOUTH SAN FRANCISCO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY SIX POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING A DNA MEDICAL KIT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. OUTER BOX IS PREPRINTED ALDEVRON, TEMPERATURE SENSITIVE PRODUCT WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER F770E0, OVERLAND PHARMACEUTICALS, 200 CLARENDON ST, BOSTON MA 02116-5021.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: External packaging was wet on all four sides, top and bottom and subsequently placed into a plastic lined container and removed from the discovery site. DescribePack: The cap was unsealed such that the liquid seeped from where the bottom edge circumference joined with the bottle neck. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up using neutral absorbent material , and the rest of the shipment was encapsulated within a plastic lined container for inspection and processing.

item.description:
Report E-2024030190

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal ULX experienced a UN1727 Ammonium Biflouride release from a 50-pound poly bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 pound of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged bag and released material were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining bags were re-stacked and secured for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

When inspected, two bottles inside package was found with loose caps causing leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on plastic bottle was the cause of the leakage.   • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PROHIBITED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE MARKED AS A HAZARDOUS WASTE. PACKAGE SHOULD NEVER HAVE BEEN ACCEPTED. HAS FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND LABEL. DescribePack: SEVERAL GLASS BOTTLES BROKEN. MAJORITY OF GOODS ARE PLASTIC BOTTLES. SPILL ISOLATED TO DRUM. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

DescribePack: The edge circumference of the can was dented on one side such that the lid did not fit properly to the can body despite the presence of can clips to secure it. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up by absorbent material. The rest of the package was placed into as plastic lined container for inspection and processing.

HAS BEEN MISLOADED BY ORIGIN AND BEEN IN NEED OF HAP SINCE JAN 18TH TO FEB 22ND. UNDER FURTHER INSPECTION OF GOODS, FOUND THAT THE BOTTLE HAS LOST MATERIALS, NOT A FULL GALLON. DescribePack: BOTTLE LEAKED 2 TENTHS OF A GALLON FROM CAP OVER A PERIOD OF OVER A MONTH. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2024030357
item.description:
Report X-2024030357

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The Damaged Hazmat came down the sorter onto the flex. The package was discovered to be wet from the side of the package. The package was then placed into a red bin and Hazmat bag to be properly worked on. DescribePack: The package when discovered had a wet spot on the side of the box about 3 inches in length. Upon opening the package, it was viewed to be caused by a loose cap on one of the bottles of Zep Liquid heat. The loose cap leaked out liquid onto itself, another bottle, and the box. The loose cap had loose play to it compared to the others which had a tightly placed cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a red bin and hazmat bag in case any of its contents continued to leak. The package was also placed up in accordance with its load arrows to prevent any more spillage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler realized package was wet and most likely leaking and informed his Manager. Manager Placed package inside a hazmat bag with absorbent, and informed QA Admin. QA Admin came with hazmat tote and placed hazmat bag with leaky package and absorbent inside the tote. DescribePack: The top cap of two bottles came loose and caused liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Wet Package was placed inside a hazmat bag with absorbent.
